channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.
channel.copyright: Copyright:(C) Sun, 20 Oct 2024 08:00:55 IST Bennett Coleman & Co. Ltd, http://in.indiatimes.com/policyterms/1554651.cms

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: 'Just too easy to hack’: Elon Musk claims voting machines rig elections, calls for paper ballots
item.description: Elon Musk, during a Pennsylvania town hall, linked Dominion Voting Systems to alleged election rigging in Philadelphia and Arizona, advocating for paper ballots. Dominion countered, clarifying their non-operation in Philadelphia and emphasizing their system's accuracy through audits. Musk's remarks have intensified election security debates ahead of the 2024 campaign.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: China: President Xi directs PLA rocket force to strengthen deterrence and combat capabilities
item.description: China's President Xi Jinping inspected a brigade of the People's Liberation Army Rocket Force, emphasizing the need to enhance deterrence and combat capabilities. Xi urged the troops to strengthen targeted training with new equipment and methods, reinforcing the Party's absolute leadership. Meanwhile, Taiwan reported increased Chinese military activities near its territory.

item.title: King Charles makes his first public appearance during Australia tour
item.description: King Charles III made his first public appearance in Sydney since his cancer diagnosis. His 9-day Australia tour includes addressing the New South Wales parliament and private meetings. Due to his health, large gatherings are limited. A group of protesters near a church called for Australia to 'decolonise,' reflecting mixed feelings about the monarchy.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pro-Liberation writers’ group attacked in Dhaka
item.description: Around 100 people attacked the Creative Writers Association during a protest in Dhaka after the cancellation of March 7 and August 15 as national days. The mob assaulted the protesters, identifying them with the Awami League, and chased them away. The Liberal Democratic Party called for banning the Awami League.

item.title: Fresh trouble for Harry Meghan? Locals of Portugal's Comporta don't want Royals to settle there
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan face local backlash in Portugal for purchasing a holiday home, with residents upset over wealthy property owners restricting beach access. UK Express reported that restricting access to public beaches was illegal in Portugal until recently but new regulations now allow local councils and government agencies to designate certain beaches as "private".
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Diddy was obsessed with Prince Harry, William because...' reveals ex-aide
item.description: Amid speculations over the princes' connection with the disgraced singer, Rob Shuter said Diddy's obsession with the princes was natural because he used to think himself as the king. "He thinks of himself as a king, so it makes perfect sense that he would like to have two princes in his entourage," Shuter said confirming that William and Harry never accepted Diddy's offer to join him.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Rosie O'Donnell's daughter arrested for child neglect, 11-month-old found near meth pipe
item.description: Rosie O'Donnell's 27-year-old daughter, Chelsea Belle O'Donnell, faces child neglect and drug charges after police found her 11-month-old son near meth pipe. Officers discovered her Wisconsin home in disarray and uncovered evidence of drug trafficking and meth production, including needles, meth pipes, and 18 grams of meth. Chelsea called the police over a dispute with her boyfriend but the police uncovered drug trafficking at her place.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: Lara Trump dances to Taylor Swift's song in campaign video; Swifties call it 'cringe'
item.description: Swift's fans are outraged over a Trump campaign video where Lara Trump and others dance to an edited version of Taylor Swift's song '22,' repurposed to support Donald Trump. Swift has previously clarified her political stance, endorsing Kamala Harris, and condemned the misleading use of her image.After Taylor's endorsement for Harris, Donald Trump said he hates Taylor Swift.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Laura Loomer says Harris should go to therapy for grief, nobody cares for her mother
item.description: Far-right activist Laura Loomer criticized Vice President Kamala Harris over a post about her late mother's battle with cancer. Loomer harshly commented that no one cares about Harris' grief and suggested Harris should drop out of the presidential race. Loomer is known for controversial remarks, even drawing disapproval from GOP circles and former President Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Last few hours of singer Liam Payne's life at Buenos Aires hotel: New details emerge
item.description: Liam Payne's final hours in a Buenos Aires hotel before his fatal fall involved hallucinogenic drugs, alcohol, and an argument with a mystery woman. He partied with two escorts and displayed erratic behavior, smashing his laptop after an upsetting email. Police found drugs and alcohol in his chaotic room. Liam and his girlfriend Cassidy flown to Argentina to support Payne's former One Direction bandmate Niall Horan who had a concert there on October 2. But Cassidy left Argentina early though Liam begged her to stay.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: John Fetterman says Elon Musk is a concern for Democrats: 'Some people see him as Tony Stark'
item.description: ​Elon Musk has gone all out for supporting Donald Trump and will be a part of the Trump administration if the former president in back to the White House. Soon after the first assassination attempt of Donald Trump in Butler in July, Elon Musk announced his endorsement for Trump. As Donald Trump returned to Butler first time after the assassination attempt, he had Elon Musk with him and now Elon Musk is holding solo events in support of Donald Trump.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 81-year-old Georgia woman votes for the first time as her late husband never let her
item.description: At 81, Betty Cartledge cast her first vote in Georgia after her husband, who never allowed her to participate, passed away. Cartledge's newfound sense of civic duty has made her a social media sensation, with many praising her milestone and criticizing her late husband's authoritarian control. “I was so young and everything when we got married, I never really thought about it,” Cartledge said. “And then I got old, and I thought that it wouldn’t count to vote.”
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Royal Family on red alert over ominous warning from man who claimed to be King Charles' 'secret lovechild'
item.description: Simon Dorante-Day insists he's the love child of King Charles and Camilla, demanding a DNA test. As the Royals tour Australia, Dorante-Day plans to confront them. Royal bodyguards are on alert, monitoring individuals closely, especially anyone who makes a lot of noise in the public like Simon. He believes his facial resemblance to Charles proves his claim, emphasizing his supposed royal lineage.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Delta flight asks Marine Corps veteran to change her 'threatening' t-shirt or get down
item.description: “I feel like they just took my soul away. I’m not a bad person, and that T-shirt, I should be allowed to support myself and veterans,” Marines Corps veteran Catherine Banks said as she was asked to get off a Delta flight because her T-shirt had the word 'suicide' in it.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'We are going to ... ': Watch what Israel PM Benjamin Netanyahu said after drone from Lebanon targets his home
item.description: A Lebanese drone targeted Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's residence, prompting him to reaffirm Israel's stance against Iran-backed militants. Netanyahu highlighted the recent killing of terrorist leader Yahya Sinwar by the IDF and emphasized their commitment to victory. Meanwhile, Hezbollah escalated the conflict with rocket attacks on northern Israel, including areas near Haifa and Safed.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Man arrested after firebombing Japan’s ruling party headquarters, crashing car into PM's residence
item.description: A 49-year-old man, Atsunobu Usuda, launched firebombs at Japan's ruling LDP headquarters in Tokyo and crashed into the Prime Minister's residence fence. He was arrested, with motives possibly linked to financial frustrations over public office candidacy. The LDP faces declining support amid financial controversies ahead of upcoming elections.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: From ballistic missiles to nuclear-capable bombers: A look at Russia's military powers
Cuba blackout: Millions plunged into darkness after nation's biggest power plant fails
item.description: cuba blackout: millions plunged into darkness after nation's biggest power plant fails

item.title: 'Will not halt Axis of Resistance': Iran reacts to Hamas leader Sinwar's death
item.description: Iran's Supreme Leader, Ayatollah Khamenei, extends condolences on the death of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar, emphasizing that Hamas will persevere. Despite Sinwar’s death, Khamenei reassures Iran's unwavering support for the Palestinian resistance, highlighting the resilience of the resistance front against Israel.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Elon Musk 'cant stop laughing' over The Atlantic's Trump-Hitler comparison
item.description: Billionaire Elon Musk mocked an article by The Atlantic, which compared Donald Trump's rhetoric to that of dictators Hitler, Stalin, and Mussolini. The article cites Trump's use of terms like 'vermin' and 'poisoning the blood' to illustrate his polarizing language. This sparked debate online about the media's portrayal of Trump and its impact on public discourse.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
